summary: In 1972, Title IX required equity for women in college athletics. Yet 50 years later, women still participate in college athletics at lower rates than men—despite enrolling in college at higher rates. The Department of Education enforces Title IX. It obtains agreements from some colleges to resolve potential compliance issues and monitors their actions. In some of the 26 cases we reviewed, Education took over...
title: College Athletics: Education Should Improve Its Title IX Enforcement Efforts
